desc: MEF2BNB-MEF2B (also known as BORCS8-MEF2B) is a gene that encodes for the transcription factor MEF2B, which has important function in normal tissue development (PMID: 26506234). MEF2B can recruit either activators or repressors to its target genes (PMID: 22955990, 12700764). MEF2B target genes include known oncogenes such as MYC (PMID: 22955990, 12700764). T-cell receptor mediated apoptosis is mediated by MEF2B (PMID: 10531067). MEF2B mutations have been observed in various lymphomas (PMID: 21796119, 22343534). These mutations seem to lead to deregulated BCL6 expression and disregulation of cell migration (PMID: 23974956, 26245647)

desc: BORCS8-MEF2B (also known as MEF2BNB-MEF2B) is a transcription factor that is important for the development of various tissues and plays an important role in cell differentiation. It is mutated in lymphoma and seems to exhibit oncogenic as well as tumor suppressor functions in different tumor entities.
